snippet: President Obama pledged to crack down on what he called “weapons of war,” but the White House is emphasizing other measures it deems more politically achievable.
abstract: Pres Obama pledges to crack down on 'weapons of war' but is emphasizing other measures it deems more politically achievable;  as task force led by Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr  readies recommendations on reducing gun violence for delivery to Obama, in aftermath of Newtown, Conn, schoolhouse massacre, White House has calculated that ban on military-style assault weapons will be exceedingly difficult to pass through Congress and is focusing on gun rules that could win bipartisan support.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and PETER BAKER

lead_paragraph: President Obama pledged to crack down on what he called “weapons of war,” but the White House is emphasizing other measures it deems more politically achievable.

headline.seo: Obama Sees Tough Path on Assault Gun Ban
headline.main: Tough Path Seen by Obama on Ban of Assault Weapons
headline.print_headline: Tough Path Seen By Obama on Ban Of Assault Arms
